definition: soup/hot or boiling water/decoction of medicinal herbs/water in which sth has been boiled

sentences.english: The family plate included a silver pitcher, and knives, forks and spoons.
sentences.chinese: 家庭餐具包括一個銀製的大水罐，還有刀叉和湯匙。

sentences.english: Many women ejaculate a smaller amount, around a teaspoon.
sentences.chinese: 很多女人射出了很少的量，大約一湯匙。

sentences.english: She spoon-fed her son until he was age six and people began to laugh.
sentences.chinese: 她用湯匙喂兒子喂到他六歲，人們開始嘲笑她。

sentences.english: Blend egg with 2 tbsp of mungbean flour. Add in chicken and mix well.
sentences.chinese: 雞蛋加生粉2湯匙拌勻成濃糊狀，加入雞塊攔勻。

sentences.english: She stirred her coffee with a spoon.
Rub cucumber slices with 1 tbsp salt.
sentences.chinese: 用1湯匙鹽放入黃瓜段裏撮勻。

sentences.english: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large nonstick skillet over high heat.
sentences.chinese: 在一隻大的不粘鍋中高火加熱一大湯匙油。

sentences.english: She licked the honey off the spoon.
Meanwhile, combine sour cream, 1 teaspoon vanilla, and 1 cup sugar.
sentences.chinese: 同時，將酸奶油，1湯匙香草香精和一杯糖混合。

sentences.english: Combine powdered sugar and 2 tablespoons lemon juice in small bowl.
sentences.chinese: 在一小碗中將糖粉及2湯匙檸檬汁混勻。

sentences.english: Chopsticks and spoon can be put in special seat, or put on paper sets.
sentences.chinese: 筷子與湯匙可放在專用的座子上，或放在紙套中。

sentences.english: One table-spoonful to be taken at bed-time.
sentences.chinese: 睡前要喝掉滿滿一湯匙。

sentences.english: Another lovely super spoon Cross back.
sentences.chinese: 另外一尾可愛的湯匙頭形過背。

sentences.english: Place a rounded tablespoonful of filling in lower right corner of strip.
sentences.chinese: 舀滿滿一湯匙的餡倒在麪皮的右下角處。

sentences.english: Pan-fry beaten egg to form a thick sheet. Cut into 12 pieces.
sentences.chinese: 用1湯匙油將雞蛋煎成厚蛋皮，切成12塊。

sentences.english: Dogs eat the darndest things. From fish hooks to spoons, MY DOG ATE WHAT?
sentences.chinese: 狗狗最愛胡亂地把東西吞下，包括從魚鉤到湯匙。
